Scheme 1 Electrochemical oxidative C–H/N–H cross-coupling for C–N bond formation with hydrogen evolution.
Scheme 3 Proposed mechanism of the intermolecular oxidative C–H/N–H cross-coupling reaction.
Scheme 4 Proposed mechanism of the intramolecular oxidative C–H/N–H cross-coupling reaction.

Table 1 Optimization of the reaction conditionsa [a] Standard conditions: graphite rod anode, nickel plate cathode, constant current = 8 mA,1a(0.3 mmol),2a(2.0 equiv.), NaNO3(0.3 mmol), MeCN (4.8 mL), H2O (1.0 mL), EtOH (1.2 mL), 50 °C, 5 h (5.0 F mol−1), undivided cell. [b] Yields were determined by1H NMR using naphthalene as the internal standard. [c] Isolated yields.

Table 2 Substrate scope of the electrochemical intermolecular oxidative C–H/N–H cross-coupling reactiona [a] Standard conditions: graphite rod anode, nickel plate cathode, constant current = 8 mA,1(0.3 mmol),2(2.0 equiv.), NaNO3(0.3 mmol), MeCN (4.8 mL), H2O (1.0 mL), EtOH (1.2 mL), 50 °C, 5 h (5.0 F mol−1), undivided cell. [b] 4.5 h (4.5 F mol−1). [c] 2a(3.0 equiv.).

Table 3 Substrate scope of the electrochemical intramolecular oxidative C–H/N–H cross-coupling reactiona [a] Standard conditions: graphite rod anode, nickel plate cathode, constant current = 8 mA,4(0.3 mmol), Cp2Fe (20 mol%),nBu4NBF4(0.3 mmol), MeCN (3.5 mL), EtOH (3.5 mL), 70 °C, 4 h (4.0 F mol−1), undivided cell.
